intro: Capnoides streptocarpa, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or purple. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. Capnoides streptocarpa is adapted to cold, mountainous environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
